thread.title: The Price Gap That’s Squeezing the Auto Market

author: Stephen Wilmot
title: The Price Gap That’s Squeezing the Auto Market
text:
Car-industry profits depend as much on the type of cars sold as on their number. Even a high plateau for car sales could be an inhospitable place for investors.

U.S. car sales remain strong by historical standards, but last year slipped 1.8%—the first annual decline since the 2008 recession. A major reason for this downturn, despite the strong economy, is increasingly stiff competition from the secondhand market, which is inundated with cars coming off three-year leases.
